Title: Split a poem into topical segments
Description: Label where the topic changes in a poem and describe each segment in a few words
Answer.10description: Large rocks or small are ejected from the previously described location
Answer.11description: Something is happening in the middle of this ejection of rocks
Answer.12description: We are now taken back to the river in 3-5
Answer.13description: Now Kubla, an obscure character in the poem, begins to experience something
Answer.14description: The dome that was described as part of the locale of Xanadu in 1-2 is casting its presence on the water
Answer.15description: This water is the location where words are heard coming from a fountain and caves
Answer.16description: Introduction of a deeper description of the dome from 1-2 ad 31-32
Answer.17description: Captivation of the narrator by a woman from Abyssinia playing music
Answer.18description: Narrator recalls how the music was so beautiful he would like to recall within him the effect it had on him
Answer.19description: Description of what the narrator would accomplish if he could hear the music again within him
Answer.20description: Now turning to a description of how the dome would affect others
Answer.21description: The closing of the poetic representation in a statement of what one should do in response to all of this
Answer.2description: Description of the river and where it flows
Answer.3description: Description of an area of land surrounded by walls
Answer.4description: Description of gardens and their content
Answer.5description: Description of forests and their environs
Answer.7description: An expansion of the meaning of this location
Answer.9description: A deeper attempt to describe what arises
Answer.comments: I'm interested to know how precisely you are hoping people will break this down, also what the purpose of this experiment is. Also interested to know whether it is normal to feel that different aspects of this can change but yet overlap...

Title: Split a poem into topical segments
Description: Label where the topic changes in a poem and describe each segment in a few words
Answer.10description: He saw a vision of a woman playing a dulcimer and singing.
Answer.11description: He wants to remember the woman and hear her song again so he can recreate the pleasure-dome that shares with everyone how wonderful it is to hear her sing and play.
Answer.12description: Everyone who would see the dome would be scared and cautious of him because they would know he had experience paradise.
Answer.1description: Kubla Khan decreed a pleasure dome in Xanadu.
Answer.2description: A description of the sacred river Alph.
Answer.3description: A small space of fertile ground with gardens and forests.
Answer.4description: The space is beautiful and enchanted.
Answer.5description: A fountain erupts from the chasm.
Answer.6description: Rocks burst up from the chasm.
Answer.7description: The river ran through an undisturbed area to a dark ocean.
Answer.8description: Kubla heard noises warning of war.
Answer.9description: The shadow of the pleasure-dome was found because of the noise.

Title: Split a poem into topical segments
Description: Label where the topic changes in a poem and describe each segment in a few words
Answer.14description: description of the source of the sound
Answer.15description: expression of awe for the palace and its environs
Answer.16description: description of the author's vision of a singing woman
Answer.17description: author's statement of desire to create Xanadu
Answer.18description: expression of the fear and awe inspired by KK
Answer.8description: event involving a geyser or something similar
Answer.9description: comparison of the event to various other things

Title: Split a poem into topical segments
Description: Label where the topic changes in a poem and describe each segment in a few words
Answer.10description: meanwhile, in the shadow of the pleasure dome where it was sunny, there were caves filled with ice
Answer.11description: There was an Abyssinian maid playing a dulcimer
Answer.12description: She was singing about Mt Abora
Answer.13description: Story teller is remembering and describing the music
Answer.14description: Story teller refers again to the pleasure dome and the ice caves
Answer.15description: This is an admonition to anybody who sees the pleasure dome and ice caves
Answer.16description: A description of a person who saw the palace and caves. He had long hair
Answer.17description: A recounting of what happened to the man and what he did
Answer.1description: Kubla Kahn built a pleasure dome in Xanadu
Answer.2description: Discription of the location beside a river
Answer.3description: Description of the pleasure dome and surrounding grounds
Answer.4description: But the place was haunted by a woman crying for her lost love
Answer.5description: The grounds around the haunted place erupted (like a volcano)
Answer.6description: Description of eruption includes rock that came down like hail
Answer.7description: Alternate description of eruption as the chaf of grain
Answer.8description: Description of what happened to the river as a result of the eruption
Answer.9description: While the eruption was happening, Kubla Kahn was warned of a coming war
Answer.comments: I hope I did this correctly.  It was fun.  Would like to do this exercise again on another poem.  I had trouble with lines 50-54.  I was going to leave it as one topic--but I was not satisfied.  So I broke it out.
